alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Coahoma; Lafayette; Panola; Quitman; Tallahatchie; Yalobusha (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 30 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of North Mississippi, including the following counties, Calhoun, Coahoma, Lafayette, Panola, Quitman, Tallahatchie and Yalobusha. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 545 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oxford, Clarksdale, Batesville, Water Valley, Charleston, George Payne State Park, Holly Springs National Forest, Tutwiler, Bruce, Marks, Lambert, Jonestown, Coffeeville, Crowder, Webb, Sumner, Pope, Enid, Scobey and Paynes. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Coahoma; Lafayette; Panola; Quitman; Tallahatchie; Yalobusha
